content.value_statement: Need to create interactive charts that users can hover, zoom, and explore. Plotly provides 40+ chart types with built-in interactivity for dashboards and presentations. Use Plotly for web-embeddable visualizations.
actual_capabilities: Create 40+ chart types including scatter, line, bar, pie, histogram, box plot, violin, heatmap, and 3D charts
Build interactive visualizations with hover tooltips, zoom, pan, and legend toggling
Export charts as interactive HTML or static images (PNG, PDF, SVG)
Create multi-panel dashboards using subplots with shared axes
Apply themes and custom styling including colors, fonts, templates, and annotations
Generate statistical charts with trendlines, marginal plots, and distribution comparisons
limitations: Static publication figures may be better served by matplotlib for simpler workflows
Browser rendering required for interactive features to function
Large datasets may require additional optimization for smooth interactivity

best_practices: Use Plotly Express (px) for quick visualizations with pandas DataFrames
Combine Plotly Express with Graph Objects for fine-grained customization
Export to HTML for web embedding or kaleido for static images
anti_patterns: Using Graph Objects when Plotly Express would be simpler and faster
Forgetting to call fig.show() or fig.write_html() to display or save the chart
Not specifying data types explicitly when working with datetime or categorical data

faq.question: What is the difference between Plotly Express and Graph Objects?
faq.answer: Plotly Express is a high-level API for quick charts in 1-5 lines. Graph Objects provides low-level control for custom visualizations.

faq.question: How do I create a static image from my chart?
faq.answer: Install kaleido (uv pip install kaleido) then use fig.write_image('chart.png') to export to PNG, PDF, or SVG.

faq.question: Can I embed Plotly charts in web applications?
faq.answer: Yes, use fig.write_html('chart.html') to generate standalone HTML. The chart includes Plotly.js and works offline.

faq.question: How do I create multi-panel charts?
faq.answer: Use make_subplots from plotly.subplots to create grid layouts. Add traces to specific rows and columns with fig.add_trace().

faq.question: What chart types support animations?
faq.answer: Most chart types support animation_frame parameter. Plotly Express automatically creates animations for categorical or time-based data.

faq.question: How do I customize colors and styling?
faq.answer: Use template parameter (plotly_white, plotly_dark, etc.), color_continuous_scale for gradients, or update_traces() for fine control.
